channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Hodge House, Granville Road, NW6, 13th November
item.description:
Dog Mess Outside The Block. DISTRESSING for Residents and Passerby’s, Across from The Tabot Centre Children’s Nursery and NASTY for Everyone having to walk by it. Elderly and Children. Needs clearing ASAP. NEED NO DOG MESS SIGNS on Granville Road NW6 as this is A MAJOR PROBLEM. Dog Walkers are Making their Dogs MESS, and NOT Removing it. Please Remove from Hodge House ASAP, as anyone will step on it and Spread it Causing MORE GERMS.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Granville Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Here we go again. Sinkhole reappearing!, 13th November
item.description:
For the past few years you have attempted to fix this. And here we are again with it causing issues and its going to cause an accident as every driver would rather swerve into the left lane than damage their vehicle.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): James Watt Way, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Terrible repair job causing issues again., 13th November
item.description:
This pothole has been here for the past 3 years. In February 2025 it was filled in like this. It was reported and notging was done about it. Leading us to now. A delivery driver crossing the road carrying parcels fell over after tripping and twisting his ankle. This is highly unsafe and I have not got an up to date photo but its not my job to take photos. Someone needs to come out and fix this before something worse happens. What if it was an elderly person? The whole sole of your foot can fit in where its dipped hence how he tripped. Outside no.41

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thanet Road, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 246-248 Kilburn High Road, 13th November
item.description:
Broken and chipped paving stones either side of the entrance, caused by construction vehicles. This is a significant trip hazard and failure of the constructors of the flats. They have recently tarmacked the lose paving bricks in a very rough manner. I've reported this at least twice before and there has been no enforcement to the fiat owners the cause of a public hazard and obstacle to the public footpath. This requires immediate attention and in my view and the service of an enforcement notice on the building owners or for the council to carry out the vital repairs and charge the block owners. This is a historic problem and shows the contempt by the building owners to the public pavement and safety.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kilburn High Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green telecomms cabinet near 82, South Eden Park Rd, Eden Park, Beckenham - nr jct with Hawksbrook Lane - spray tag., 13th November
item.description:
Green telecomms cabinet near 82, South Eden Park Rd, Eden Park, Beckenham - nr jct with Hawksbrook Lane - spray tag. Seen Wed 12/11/25 I'm doing this report from memory hours after seeing it from a moving vehicle and I think this is the location. Otherwise it is the other side of the metal rail bridge by 64 South Eden Park Rd, also on a cabinet.

item.title: Building with overly bright poorly directed flood light, 13th November
item.description:
This school has several extremely bright and poorly directed flood lights on constantly throughout the night, every single night. You can see surrounding buildings all lid up in slightly white blue tone, due to these light from this building.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Egerton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
